alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 4:12PM PDT until June 08 at 6:15PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Medford has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The McKinney burn scar in... North Central Siskiyou County in northern California... * Until 615 PM PDT. * At 412 PM PDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the McKinney Burn Scar. Flash flooding is already occurring. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Some drainage basins impacted include...McKinney Creek, Barkhouse Creek, Humbug Creek, Little Humbug Creek, and Vesa Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the McKinney Burn Scar. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...High water and debris could impact Highway 96, Klamath River Road, and Humbug Creek Road. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the McKinney Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
